alert.note: Alert for Lee; Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lee and northeastern Macon Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 742 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Notasulga, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Tuskegee, Notasulga, Tuskegee National Forest, Society Hill, Lake Tuskegee, Loachapoka, I 85 Rest Area, Uphapee Creek and Moton Field Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
